title: 'Pokemon Legends: Z-A' Teases New Mega Evolution From Gen VI Game 'Pokemon X/Y'
description: Pokemon Legends: Z-A seems to have a new Mega Evolution coming to the game, and it is from Generation VI's Kalos region.
content:
There is a new "Pokémon Legends: Z-A" teaser based on a recent video shared by the official Pokémon account on X, and many are speculating that this could be referring to a new Mega Evolution coming to the game.

The official X account of Pokémon recently shared a video, which shows many fans celebrating a creature known as Malamar. This has already been making waves online as speculations claim it could be the next Mega Evolution.

The video itself does not mention anything specific about Malamar being included in the upcoming game or having its own Mega Evolution version.

As seen in the video, users are going all out in celebration of the upside-down squid Pokémon which made its debut in the Kalos region, with many creating graffiti art, giving away plushies, and wearing shirts inspired by the creature.

The super fans shown on the video were speaking highly about their love for Malamar, showing off different accessories in honor of the creature.

Reports and user speculations claim that this video could be a potential hint regarding the next Mega Evolution coming to the game. Users have mixed reactions to Malamar getting its version of a Mega Evolution, and while it is a relatively famous Pokémon from the said game, others were in disbelief of this choice.

The Pokémon X Account did not mention anything about this being part of "Pokémon Legends: Z-A." It should be noted that confirmed Mega Evolutions and new creature additions like Hawlucha and Machamp's Mega faceoff, contained the game's hashtag, signifying that it is for the title.

Malamar first appeared on the 12-year-old game "Pokémon X/Y," which gave users a grand experience of the massive Kalos region. The Pokémon is best known to be the evolved version of Inkay, and features two types of power, namely Dark and Psychic.

It is also important to note that Malamar is among the few Pokémon which has a unique evolution requirement, with players required to turn their Nintendo 3DS console upside down after leveling up an Inkay to Level 30.

However, it is important to note that this is still a speculation based on the video and how fans reacted to The Pokémon Company's post as there are no official confirmations as of writing from the developers.

Should Malamar have its own Mega Evolution in "Pokémon Legends: Z-A," the creature would be the second Generation VI Pokémon to get this special power-up following Mega Hawlucha.
summary: The official Pokémon account on X has shared a teaser about a new Mega Evolution from its Gen VI game, "Pokémon Legends: Z-A". The video shows fans celebrating a creature named Malamar, who first appeared on the game "Pokémon X/Y," with many creating art and gifts. The official X account did not mention any specific details about Malamar being included in the upcoming game or having its own Mega Evolution. If Malamar has its own version of the Mega Evolution, it would be the second Generation VI Pokémon to receive this power-up. However, there are no official confirmations from the developers regarding this speculation.
shortSummary: A video posted by the Pokémon X account hints at the next Mega Evolution, with Malamar featuring an upside-down squid Pokémon.

scraped_sources.text:
The new "Pokémon Legends Z-A" trailer surprised fans with a darker take on the favorite franchise: Mega Victreebel center stage in all its frightening splendor.
A far cry from the typical light-hearted Pokémon tales, this teaser embraces horror-gameplay elements, similar to survival favorites such as "Resident Evil."
Mega Victreebel Appears in Lumiose City
The trailer, "The Case of the Sweet Scent Incident," shows two young trainers venturing into a dark, empty building in Lumiose City. Curiosity soon turns to danger as they hear odd sounds, disturbing odors, and puddles of corrosive liquids spread all over the floors.
Their research comes to a chilling conclusion as they observe a man beaten up by a Mega Evolution version of Victreebel.
Dubbed Mega Victreebel, this grotesque appearance takes its sweet-scented acid to perilous extremes, resulting in the purple slime found oozing across the walls. Its disturbing appearance, that of an overstuffed sack with its top tied, makes Mega Victreebel one of the most frightening Pokémon evolutions so far.
Pokémon Horror Elements is What Most Fans Did Not Expect
What is interesting about this trailer is its horror-infused direction. The atmosphere is that of a survival thriller more than a classic Pokémon game, combining suspense with the possibility of direct harm. This is in line with "Pokémon Legends: Arceus," which initially taught players about the threat of wild Pokémon attacks. It diverges from the franchise's characteristic peaceful environment.
The Pokémon Company trailer indicates that "Pokémon Legends Z-A" will carry on this tradition, with missions that push trainers to investigate peculiar occurrences throughout Lumiose City. Fans theorize that these investigative missions will become the focus of the narrative, highlighting how humans and Pokémon are forced to live in a major city setting despite the dangers.
The Story Behind the Sweet Scent Incident
While the trailer makes Mega Victreebel look frightening, the press release explains that this monster is owned by a construction worker trainer. He had just been training his partner Pokémon without realizing how its acid overflow would become out of control.
The Pokémon Company knows that through storytelling, players will be more curious about people's normal relationships with Pokémon.
What to Expect from 'Pokémon Legends Z-A'
Indeed, a Resident Evil-inspired trailer is not on everyone's bingo list of "Pokémon Legends Z-A." This glimpse gave us hope that the game's graphics can be improved further in the future. It's an ambitious innovation that hit a home run for both Pokémon and horror fans.
At the same time, some gamers think that the recent Mega Evolutions look goofy. Before Mega Victreebel, Mega Dragonite was the talk of the town on Reddit and other platforms. Some people appreciate its majestic look, but others said that it looks awkward and forced.

On September 4, Pokemon Legends: Z-A posted a strange video that showed trainers going crazy over Malamar, which could indicate the sixth-generation critter may receive a Mega Evolution in the upcoming title. While past Pokemon Legends: Z-A leaks indicated that Malamar would receive a Mega Evolution form, The Pokemon Company has kept further details under wraps.
Known as the Overturning Pokemon, Malamar first appeared in Pokemon X and Y as the evolved form of Inkay. Malamar is a squid-like Dark and Psychic Pokemon that has a unique evolution method. After leveling an Inkay to 30, it can become a Malamar by turning the respective game console of the Pokemon game being played upside down. Though its base stats are average across the board, Malamar can learn the fittingly named move Topsy-Turvy to reverse the stat changes of its target and turn its power against it. Malamar can also use various attacks, such as Superpower, Night Slash, and Psybeam, to wear down its foes.
Pokemon Shares Strange Malamar Video Montage
One week after revealing Mega Hawlucha is coming to Pokemon Legends: Z-A, The Pokemon Company offered a short but strange video that focused entirely on Malamar. On Pokemon's various social media feeds, the company posted a cryptic video titled "Malamar.mp4" that showed different people expressing their excitement over Malamar. One clip portrayed Malamar as a graffiti art mural, while another showed a man driving a car filled with several Malamar plush dolls and stickers. The third clip of the video showed another man dancing while wearing a Malamar shirt. In response to the surprising video post, Pokemon fans guessed that it was a tease for Mega Malamar, which would mark the second Gen 6 creature to receive a Mega form in Pokemon Legends: Z-A, following Mega Hawlucha's reveal.
The Pokemon Company did not share any further details related to Malamar. While not officially confirmed as of this writing, a previous leak that listed the new Pokemon Legends: Z-A Mega Evolutions included Malamar on the list of candidates. So far, the leaked Mega Evolution list is a perfect 3-for-3, as Mega Dragonite, Victreebel, and Hawlucha have been officially revealed in various videos.
However, 23 additional Mega Evolutions listed in the leaks have yet to be confirmed in any official capacity. With Pokemon Legends: Z-A's October 16 release date fast approaching, it remains to be seen how many more Mega Evolutions will be revealed beforehand, and which ones will be left for players to discover in-game.
